samples.question: Do you often wear jewelry?
samples.transcript: >> Well, not really because I prefer a simple and minimalist style in my daily life. Sometimes I go grab a watch, but I do not really consider that a jewelry. >> Fair enough.

samples.question: And do you ever buy jewelry at all?
samples.transcript: >> Well, just once in a while. Usually as a gift to somebody else. For myself, I would prefer to buy a few high quality pieces rather than buying a lot of trendy items. >> that is great.

samples.question: So, how often do you send text messages?
samples.transcript: >> I send text messages almost every day. It is one of the most common and effective ways of communication. So, I guess everyone just do it. >> Fair enough.
samples.transcript_original: >> I send text messages almost every day. It is one of the most common and effective ways of communication. So, I guess everyone just do it. >> Fair enough.

samples.question: Do you reply to messages as soon as you get them or do you wait a bit?
samples.transcript: >> Actually, it depends. If it is something urgent, I do not mind replying immediately. But if I am in the middle of something, I guess I can leave it later so that I can think of my answer more probably.
samples.transcript_original: >> Actually, it depends. If it's something urgent, I don't mind replying immediately. But uh if I'm in the middle of something, I guess I can leave it later so that I can uh think of my answer more probably.

samples.question: >> Do you prefer sending text messages or making phone calls?
samples.transcript: >> I think testing is more convenient for me because I will have more time to think of my answers. However, phone calling is more suitable for longer or more serious conversation, but I do not really do it so often.

samples.question: And what kind of messages do you usually send?
samples.transcript: >> My test usually kind of practical about like some daily reminder or just making plans. Sometime I may send news or short videos to my friends just for fun. samples.question: What do you think of online advertising?
samples.transcript: >> I think online advertising is incredibly powerful but it is also becoming increasingly sophisticated and intrusive.

samples.question: This is due to what can I say about this?
samples.transcript: It is it usually it track the user behaviors. So it really raised concerns of mine about the privacy and consent. So although I think a live advertising is really beneficial, I still think it need clearer regulations to ensure the ethical use of data. >> Good.

samples.question: Do you think there is too much advertising nowadays?
samples.transcript: >> Well, I believe just well it does pop up everywhere in our life like inside the elevator or along the street or on our phones. So I think the consumption of advertisement nowadays is a little bit excessive. I think we do not need fewer advertisement. We just need smarter and more responsible kinds of advertisement that respect our intention decision. Not trying to gaslight us of the consumer reason. >> Great.

samples.question: And why do you think buying new things makes people happy?
samples.transcript: I think this is the combination of psychology and culture. Psychologically I can say that this is have already proven by science that purchasing new items can give us a small a temporary domain boost that makes us feel excited and happy. And on a cultural level, I think that it is because owning a new items associated to being a self-care or success. So that is why people want to try to prove their self identity through buying things. But I think such emotion, such feelings is kind of shortlived. So it would be lead it will lead to some kind of unnecessary betas. >> Very good. you have done great. Your test is over for now. Have a good day. >> Thank you. >> Okay.

samples.question: >> And do you prefer to practice individual sports or team sports?
samples.transcript: >> both are fun but in different ways. samples.question: So, in your country, do people cook at home as often as they did in the past?
samples.transcript: Well, I would say they cook quite often, but definitely it is been changing because these days many young men and women are working full-time. So, rarely do they have enough free time to cook meals for their family on a daily basis. So instead of cooking every single meal at home, they rather order something online or go to cafes or restaurants if they can afford it. >> Mhm.

samples.question: What do you think of people using their mobile phones during a meal?
samples.transcript: Well I think I think this is kind of behavior that is usually frowned upon in my country and in my opinion it is not really nice to use a phone like to be glued to your phone when you are sharing a meal with someone else. I think it is not polite and of course if there is no serious reason why you need to use your phone, then you should stay away from it.

samples.question: So, what do you think constitutes a healthy diet?
samples.transcript: >> I would say eating clean and staying away from different kinds of processed food or convenience food as much as you can. So wholesome home-cooked meals are the best ones in my opinion when it comes to healthy eating. And of course you should try to strike a balance between eating something delicious and healthy. I mean trying to incorporate fruit and vegetables in your meals. I think that could help you to stay healthy and fit.
samples.transcript_original: >> Um, I would say eating clean and staying away from different kinds of processed food or convenience food um as much as you can. So wholesome home-cooked meals are the best ones uh in my opinion when it comes to healthy eating. And of course uh you should try to strike a balance between eating something delicious and healthy. I mean trying to incorporate fruit and vegetables in your meals. I think that could help you to stay um healthy and fit.
